node.description:
# Hybrid Search RAG

Hybrid search performs a vector similarity search and a lexical search, compares the results of both searches, and then returns the most relevant results overall.

## Prerequisites

* An [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/)
* An [Astra DB Application Token](https://docs.datastax.com/en/astra-db-serverless/databases/create-database.html) for the Astra DB component.

## Quickstart

1. In the Astra DB component, add your Astra DB Application Token.
This connects Langflow to your Astra database.
2. Select an Astra collection that is hybrid-enabled.
For more information, see the [Datastax documentation](https://docs.datastax.com/en/astra-db-serverless/databases/hybrid-search.html).
The connection appears between the Parser component and the Astra DB component when a vector database is connected.
3. Ensure the **Lexical Terms** and **Parsed Text** ports are connected.
4. Add your OpenAI API key in the **Language Model** model component.
5. Open the Playground and ask a question, like "What are the features of my data?"
Ingest and search documents in Astra DB

advanced_search_filter.info: Optional dictionary of filters to apply to the search query.
advanced_search_filter.name: advanced_search_filter

api_endpoint.info: The API Endpoint for the Astra DB instance. Supercedes database selection.
api_endpoint.name: api_endpoint

astradb_vectorstore_kwargs.info: Optional dictionary of additional parameters for the AstraDBVectorStore.
astradb_vectorstore_kwargs.name: astradb_vectorstore_kwargs

autodetect_collection.info: Boolean flag to determine whether to autodetect the collection.
autodetect_collection.name: autodetect_collection

node.description: Please allow several seconds for creation to complete.
node.name: create_collection

01_new_collection_name.info: Name of the new collection to create in Astra DB.
01_new_collection_name.name: new_collection_name

02_embedding_generation_provider.helper_text: To create collections with more embedding provider options, go to your database in Astra DB.
02_embedding_generation_provider.info: Provider to use for generating embeddings.
02_embedding_generation_provider.name: embedding_generation_provider

03_embedding_generation_model.info: Model to use for generating embeddings.
03_embedding_generation_model.name: embedding_generation_model

04_dimension.info: Dimensions of the embeddings to generate.
04_dimension.name: dimension

collection_name.info: The name of the collection within Astra DB where the vectors will be stored.
collection_name.name: collection_name

content_field.info: Field to use as the text content field for the vector store.
content_field.name: content_field

node.description: Please allow several minutes for creation to complete.
node.name: create_database

01_new_database_name.info: Name of the new database to create in Astra DB.
01_new_database_name.name: new_database_name

02_cloud_provider.info: Cloud provider for the new database.
02_cloud_provider.name: cloud_provider

database_name.info: The Database name for the Astra DB instance.
database_name.name: database_name

deletion_field.info: When this parameter is provided, documents in the target collection with metadata field values matching the input metadata field value will be deleted before new data is loaded.
deletion_field.name: deletion_field

embedding_model.info: Specify the Embedding Model. Not required for Astra Vectorize collections.
embedding_model.name: embedding_model

environment.info: The environment for the Astra DB API Endpoint.
environment.name: environment

ignore_invalid_documents.info: Boolean flag to determine whether to ignore invalid documents at runtime.
ignore_invalid_documents.name: ignore_invalid_documents

keyspace.info: Optional keyspace within Astra DB to use for the collection.
keyspace.name: keyspace

lexical_terms.info: Add additional terms/keywords to augment search precision.
lexical_terms.name: lexical_terms

number_of_results.info: Number of search results to return.
number_of_results.name: number_of_results

reranker.info: Post-retrieval model that re-scores results for optimal relevance ranking.
reranker.name: reranker

search_method.info: Determine how your content is matched: Vector finds semantic similarity, and Hybrid Search (suggested) combines both approaches with a reranker.
search_method.name: search_method

search_query.info: Enter a query to run a similarity search.
search_query.name: search_query

search_score_threshold.info: Minimum similarity score threshold for search results. (when using 'Similarity with score threshold')
search_score_threshold.name: search_score_threshold

should_cache_vector_store.info: If True, the vector store will be cached for the current build of the component. This is useful for components that have multiple output methods and want to share the same vector store.
should_cache_vector_store.name: should_cache_vector_store

token.info: Authentication token for accessing Astra DB.
token.name: token

node.description: Uses an LLM to generate structured data. Ideal for extraction and consistency.

input_value.info: The input message to the language model.
input_value.name: input_value

output_schema.info: Define the structure and data types for the model's output.
output_schema.name: output_schema

table_schema.description: Specify the name of the output field.
table_schema.name: name

table_schema.description: Describe the purpose of the output field.
table_schema.name: description

table_schema.description: Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict).
table_schema.name: type

table_schema.description: Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.
table_schema.name: multiple

value.description: Potentially relevant keywords form the user query
value.name: keywords

schema_name.info: Provide a name for the output data schema.
schema_name.name: schema_name

system_prompt.info: The instructions to the language model for formatting the output.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

description: Explore Hybrid Search with a vector database.
name: Hybrid Search RAG
